intro: Aeridostachya dulitensis, commonly known as the Dullit's orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to the high-altitude regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and specialized growth habits. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in cool and humid environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Aeridostachya dulitensis is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
